@graph.headline: Creating Product Bundles In Shopify – Strategic Options
@graph.description: Comprehensive guide on creating product bundles in Shopify, covering app-based solutions, inventory synchronization, and strategic bundling methods.

@graph.name: How to Choose the Right Shopify Bundle Method
@graph.description: Step-by-step guide to selecting the appropriate bundling method based on inventory management and customer experience requirements.

step.name: Assess Inventory Synchronization Needs
step.text: Determine if your bundling method can handle inventory synchronization when selling multiple distinct SKUs as one bundle product.

step.name: Evaluate Manual Methods
step.text: Consider manual hacks like variants and virtual products, but understand they create inventory disconnect issues.

step.name: Review Discount Code Method
step.text: Assess using Buy X, Get Y discounts which maintain inventory accuracy but provide poor user experience.

step.name: Consider Official Shopify Bundles App
step.text: Evaluate the free, first-party solution that handles inventory correctly and works well for simple, fixed kits.

step.name: Explore Third-Party Bundle Apps
step.text: For advanced functionality like mix-and-match or build-your-own-box, consider specialized third-party applications.

@graph.name: Common Types of Product Bundles
@graph.description: Different bundle strategies and their technical requirements

itemListElement.name: Fixed Bundles
itemListElement.description: Pre-selected group of products sold for a single price, like a skincare kit. Simplest to implement technically.

itemListElement.name: Mix-and-Match Bundles
itemListElement.description: Customer builds their own bundle from pre-defined items. Requires dedicated third-party app for proper implementation.

itemListElement.name: Tiered or Volume Bundles
itemListElement.description: Pricing strategy where more items purchased equals greater savings. Can use variants or cart-level discount apps.

itemListElement.name: Subscription Bundles
itemListElement.description: Curated kits delivered on regular schedule. Requires integration between bundling and subscription management platforms.

itemListElement.name: Add-on or Cross-Sell Bundles
itemListElement.description: Frequently bought together suggestions with incentives. Usually handled by apps with product page widgets.

itemListElement.name: Video Bundles & Upsell
itemListElement.description: Using video engagement to promote upsells and bundles at optimal timing during customer journey.

@graph.name: How to Set Up Bundles Without an App (Manual Methods)
@graph.description: Manual methods for creating bundles in Shopify, including their limitations and failure points.

step.name: Product Variant Method
step.text: Create a new product, add variants for different pack sizes, set prices and SKUs for each variant. Warning: Creates inventory disconnect.

step.name: Virtual Bundle Product Method
step.text: Create a placeholder product representing the bundle, manually calculate and update inventory based on lowest-stock component.

step.name: Discount Code Method
step.text: Create Buy X Get Y discount rules in Shopify admin. Maintains inventory accuracy but provides poor customer experience.

@graph.name: How to Set Up Shopify Bundles App
@graph.description: Step-by-step process for setting up the official Shopify Bundles app.

step.name: Install the App
step.text: Go to Shopify App Store, search for 'Shopify Bundles', and install the free app.

step.name: Create Bundle
step.text: Navigate to Apps > Bundles and click 'Create bundle'. Give it an internal name.

step.name: Select Products
step.text: Choose the products and specific variants you want to include in the bundle.

step.name: Configure Bundle Product
step.text: Set the public title, description, images, and final price for the bundle product page.

step.name: Activate Bundle
step.text: Set the product status to 'Active' to make the bundle available for purchase.
